RBI warns public about deepfake videos of top officials giving financial adviceIn a press release, the central bank clarified that these videos are fake and warned people not to engage with or believe in them.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: UP bypolls: Election body cracks down, 7 cops suspended for rule violationsThe Election Commission has also ordered the suspension of seven police officials following complaints by the Samajwadi Party that voter and Aadhaar cards were being checked unlawfully.

As Maharashtra votes, 7 big factors that could swing the election decisively2024 Maharashtra Assembly Election: Maharashtra is a big state and the Assembly election issues are diverse. As Maharashtra votes today, here's a look at seven big factors, from OBC consolidation, Maratha votes to BJP-Congress direct fights, that could swing the poll decisively.

US shuts embassy in Kyiv anticipating air attack, asks staff to take shelterRussia Ukraine War: In a statement, the US embassy announced a temporary closure. US citizens in Ukraine were also advised to prepare for potential air raid alerts and take necessary precautions.

Journalist killed in BMW hit-and-run, body thrown 100 metres on impactBMW Hit and Run: A Telugu channel video journalist in Chennai was killed when he was hit by a speeding luxury car on an elevated highway. Such was the impact that he was thrown 100 m away from the accident spot.

How China won pollution battle as India allows Delhiites to choke to deathDelhi AQI: As India allows toxic air to choke Delhiites without even discussing what it would take to save its capital, Beijing in 2013 launched an all-out war with a $100-billion mission to clean its air. Beijing is no longer among the world's Top 10 polluted cities, while Delhi continues to gasp.

Body of UP Dalit girl found in sack, family claims she was killed for backing BJPKarhal Dalit Woman Murder: The family of the woman claimed that she was raped before being killed. They also alleged political motives behind the crime in Karhal, which went to polls on Wednesday.

AR Rahman uses hashtag on divorce post. Internet is puzzledAR Rahman and his wife Saira Banu announced their separation on November 19. However, the Internet was puzzled to see the composer use a bizarre hashtag on a sensitive post as this.

ED raids audit firm employee's home over 'crypto funds for Maharashtra polls' scamGaurav Mehta's name came under the spotlight after former IPS officer Ravindranath Patil named him a key witness in the 2018 cryptocurrency fraud case.

Elon Musk launched a banana to space on Starship: Here's whySpace X Starship: This lighthearted approach not only generated public interest but also showcased the company's ability to blend serious aerospace engineering with pop culture references.

Maharashtra, Jharkhand vote in NDA vs INDIA battle Live UpdatesIn Maharashtra, a total of 4,136 candidates are contesting across 288 constituencies. While in Jharkhand, more than 500 candidates, including Chief Minister Hemant Soren and his wife Kalpana Soren, are contesting in 38 of the total 81 Assembly seats.
Do you like your chai piping hot? Cancer caution aheadExperts suggest that while tea or coffee themselves may not directly contribute to cancer, their temperature can play a significant role.

Lawrence Bishnoi's brother seeks asylum in US after arrest, say sourcesGangster Anmol Bishnoi has applied for political asylum in the United States after being arrested for entering the country using fake documents, top sources said.

Bengaluru professor shocked by Class 10 AI exam paper: Code simple chatbot for 4 marksA Bengaluru-based assistant professor from the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) was shocked to see a Class 10 question paper that had asked students to code a simple chatbot for four marks.

Tilak Varma overtakes Suryakumarvto  become India's highest-ranked T20I batterICC T20I Rankings: Tilak Varma became the highest-ranked Indian T20I batter after jumping 69 spots to the No. 3 position in the latest rankings. Tilak hit hundreds in back-to-back T20Is in South Africa in November.

Is Biden trying to do a Capitol Hill on Trump with World War 3US President Joe Biden has allowed Ukraine the use of American missiles to hit deep inside Russia. Putin had warned against crossing this red line. As the Ukraine-Russia war escalates and people fear World War 3, many are asking if this was Biden's attempt at a 2021-Capitol-Hill-like situation against President-elect Donald Trump.

Italian village offers $1 homes to Americans looking to relocate after Trump winOllolai, a small, picturesque village in Italy is making headlines with an unusual pitch to Americans seeking an escape after Donald Trump's re-election: homes for as little as one euro ($1.06).

After AR Rahman, his bassist Mohini Dey announces separation from husbandMohini Dey Divorce News: Bassist Mohini Dey, renowned for her work with AR Rahman, has announced her separation from husband Mark Hartsuch.

Will US ever get a woman President? Only if she is Republican, says Bill ClintonIn the CBS News interview, Bill Clinton also expressed hope for a woman to occupy the Oval Office, saying, "I still think we'll have a female president pretty soon."

Not my voice, fake messages: Supriya Sule denies 'crypto funds for polls' chargeSupriya Sule on 'Bitcoin Scam' Allegations: The NCP (SP) leader dismissed the allegations a day after BJP's Sudhanshu Trivedi played audio clips at a presser, accusing Supriya Sule and Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole of indulging in illegal bitcoin transactions to change the results of the Assembly polls.

Min Hee-jin resigns as ADOR CEO after 7-month power struggle with HYBEMin Hee-jin has officially resigned as ADOR CEO following a seven-month power battle with HYBE. She was the creative force behind NewJeans' debut.

'Divorce Ke Liye…': Abigail, Rishab in twisted tale of marriageAbigail Pande and Rishab Chadha star in a comedic series about two journalists who accidentally end up in a marriage while investigating a scam. The show promises a roller coaster of laughs as they navigate their unexpected union.

HanuMan director Prasanth Varma says he'd quit filmmaking for his first loveDirector Prasanth Varma, who scored a major hit with HanuMan earlier this year, recently expressed his strong preference for writing stories over directing films.

Actor Arjun Bijlani casts his vote: This is the right day to voice your opinionTelevision actor Arjun Bijlani urged everyone to cast their vote. He said, "It's very important to vote. I have seen when things are going wrong, millions complain. They voice their opinion on Twitter, on social media. More than that, this is the right day to voice your opinion."

Morne Morkel hints at all-rounder's inclusionIndia's bowling coach, Morne Morkel, has offered the strongest indication that 21-year-old Nitish Reddy could make his Test debut in Perth. Praising the young all-rounder, Morkel expressed confidence in Reddy's ability to "hold one end up" for India during the upcoming five-Test series against Australia.

Shami was not included in India's 18-member jumbo squad for the Border Gavaskar Trophy series.

Australia vs India: Can weakened India breach Perth fortress?The Border-Gavaskar Trophy is almost here! Aren't you excited? India have been sensational in their last two tours of Australia. However, with a team in transition that has a few injury and availability concerns, it seems that India are on the back foot early in the series.

Call on Shubman Gill will be taken on morning of Perth Test: Morne MorkelBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Shubman Gill is racing against time to be fit for the Test series opener in Perth. Gill fractured his thumb last week after getting hit during a simulation exercise at the iconic WACA in Perth.

Brazil draw 1-1 vs Uruguay, Argentina beat Peru to close in on World Cup spotFIFA World Cup South American qualifiers: Brazil shared points with Uruguay after a 1-1 draw, while Argentina secured a narrow 1-0 win over Peru. The results leave Argentina close to World Cup qualification, with Brazil under pressure to secure their spot.

Rafael Nadal's legacy will be eternal: Carlos Alcaraz pays emotional tribute Carlos Alcaraz thanked his 'idol', Rafael Nadal, for inspiring him after the Spanish legend retired from professional tennis in Malaga. Despite their efforts, Spain's team, inspired by Nadal, could not advance in the Davis Cup.

Kohli is superstar: Ponting explains India star's magnetic pull in AustraliaFormer Australia captain Ricky Ponting recently delved into what makes Virat Kohli so revered in Australia, sharing his insights during an episode of The ICC Review with host Sanjana Ganesan.

Hardik Pandya to play Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy under brother Krunal's captaincy Hardik Pandya is set to feature in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy for Baroda, under the captaincy of his elder brother Krunal Pandya. The tournament is set to kick off on November 23, a day before the IPL 2024 mega auction takes place in Jeddah.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
